attributes.action: include on voting papers for all future political elections in the UK a box where the electorate can select “I do not wish to vote for any standing candidate”.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I feel that those members of the electorate who are not happy with any of the candidates set before them have as much right to have their choice formally recognised and reported as any of the electorate who would choose one of the candidates that are placed before them.

At present, these citizens have the following options:

They may simply stay away from the election, and not submit any voting papers.  In that case they are likely to be accused of being apathetic to the election, which may be far from the truth.  They may very intensely care about the election, but simply cannot bring themselves to support the candidates put forward.

Alternatively, they could attend the election, and spoil their ballot paper.  In that case, they are likely to be classed as simply too incompetent to properly fill in the ballot paper.  This too may be wholly untrue, and insulting, when in fact all they are trying to do is express an option that was not allowed them, that they actively choose none of the candidates before them.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/protestvotes/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
